snippet: A group of investors led by the Carlyle Group agreed on Friday to pay $689 million for the low-cost hotel chain 7 Days Group Holdings, whose shares have fallen as Chinese companies listed in the United States have run into problems.
abstract: A group of investors led by the Carlyle Group agreed on Friday to pay $689 million for the low-cost hotel chain 7 Days Group Holdings, whose shares have fallen as Chinese companies listed in the United States have run into problems.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Carlyle-Led Group to Take Chinese Hotel Chain Private
